Tabs

Organize all the content within your page

Note: You need castlecss-tabs or the castlecss-boilerplate for this.

Feel free to use these tabs to get you started. Create your own tabs.scss to overwrite the standard tabs.

How it works

Every tab-header is connected to a tab-panel. To open the correct tab-panel when the user clicks on a tab-header, we use two attributes: Each tab has an attribute data-castlecss-tab-header with a value. The value of this attibute should match the value of the attribute data-castlecss-tab-panel on the tab-panel.

Options

Full width tabs

tabs are default shown inline. With CastleCSS Tabs it is also possible to make the tabs 100% width. To do so change the tabs-header to tabs-header-full

Accordions

Sometimes it is desirable to present the tabs as accordions. CastleCSS-tabs supports this feature.

To present the tabs as accordions, change the tabs to tabs tabs-accordion. Now the tabs whill be shown as accordions.

It is also possible to present the tabs as accordions on smaller screens only. You can manage from which breakpoint you want to switch the design of the tabs.
Replace the class tabs-accordion with the class tabs-accordion-b3 to toggle the design on the third breakpoint: (< third breakpoint: accordions, >= third breakpoint: tabs)

For each breakpoint there is class: tabs-accordion-b1, tabs-accordion-b2, ... , tabs-accordion-b6

Example accordion (.tabs-accordion-b3)

To view the accordion make your screen less wide
